<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM1_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 1.&#160; Business
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Incorporation and Registered Office
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Aralez was incorporated under the British Columbia
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
	(&#8220;BCBCA&#8221;) on December 2, 2015.&#160; Our registered office is located at 666 Burrard Street, Suite 1700, Vancouver, British Columbia, V6C 2X8 and our principal executive offices are located at 151 Steeles Avenue East, Milton, Ontario, Canada, L9T 1Y1,&#160;3 Columbus Circle, Suite 1710, New York, New York, 10019,&#160;and 56 Fitzwilliam Square, Dublin 2, Ireland.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 1 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our Company
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Aralez is a global specialty pharmaceutical company focused on delivering meaningful products to improve patients&#8217; lives while focusing on creating shareholder value by acquiring, developing and commercializing products primarily in cardiovascular, pain and other specialty areas.&#160; Aralez&#8217;s global headquarters is located in Ontario, Canada, its U.S. headquarters&#160;is located&#160;in&#160;New York, New York&#160;and its Irish headquarters is located in Dublin, Ireland.&#160; Aralez was formed for the purpose of facilitating the business combination of POZEN Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#8220;Pozen&#8221;), and Tribute Pharmaceuticals Canada Inc., a corporation incorporated under the laws of the Province of Ontario, Canada (&#8220;Tribute&#8221;), which business combination was consummated on February 5, 2016.&#160; Aralez has had no operations as of December 31, 2015, other than business incident to the Tribute Transaction (as defined below).&#160; &#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our management team has a strong track record of success in creating, leading and expanding specialty pharmaceutical companies with marketing and sales capabilities.&#160; Directed by this leadership and leveraging our competitive platform, our focus on acquiring high potential growth opportunities through aggressive business development and licensing and strategic M&amp;A and commercializing healthcare products to provide enhanced value to a range of stakeholders is driven by the following primary strategies:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="9235AF7D9C5E41859C102FB8913C44A9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Maximize value of expanded portfolio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#8211; We plan to continue our progress toward building out our U.S. commercial organization, including growing our sales force and promoting the use of Fibricor
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	in the United States to grow product use moderately in the United States and which we expect will develop a relationship springboard with cardiologists ahead of the anticipated approval and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	commercial launch of YOSPRALA
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#8482;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="9A6BDD727B134FF08F9C5018745270F2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Business development through selective acquisitions
</FONT>
	&#8211; We have completed numerous transactions over the past few years to expand our portfolio offering.&#160; We will continue to pursue value-driven business development opportunities as they arise and enhance our product pipeline and expand our geographic footprint through strategically acquiring low-risk, revenue generating product candidates or approved products, particularly in the cardiovascular and pain anchor areas, but also in other specialty therapeutic areas that we anticipate are or will become revenue generating and accretive.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="2DC1A2CC057C4248897534D792BD361D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Leverage platform for growth
</FONT>
	&#8211; We intend to maintain a lean, nimble and performance-oriented operating model with strong financial discipline.&#160; Our well-capitalized financial profile provides us with ample liquidity to commercialize YOSPRALA, if and when approved, and creates the opportunity for sustained long-term growth, both organically and through acquisitions, while also enabling us to have an ongoing focus on growing shareholder value.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On February 5, 2016, pursuant to the Merger Agreement (as defined below) Aralez completed the acquisition of Tribute by way of a court approved plan of arrangement in a stock transaction with an estimated purchase price of $138 million made up of (i) $115 million related to Tribute shares, equity awards and certain warrants outstanding and (ii) $23 million in repayments of Tribute indebtedness.&#160; In connection with the transaction, Pozen and Tribute were combined under and became subsidiaries of Aralez Pharmaceuticals Inc., with Pozen treated as the acquiring company for accounting purposes (the &#8220;Tribute Transaction&#8221;).&#160; Pursuant to Rule 12g-3(a) under the Exchange Act, Aralez Pharmaceuticals Inc. is the successor issuer to Pozen.&#160; The Tribute Transaction provides the combined company with increased financial strength and product portfolio diversity and is expected to meaningfully accelerate our operating strategies.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	2015 Highlights
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On June 1, 2015, the Board of Directors of Pozen announced the appointment of Adrian Adams as Chief Executive Officer and Andrew I. Koven as President and Chief Business Officer, each effective as of May 31, 2015.&#160; At the same time, Pozen announced the retirement of John R. Plachetka, founder and Chief Executive Officer of Pozen.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">

<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On June 8, 2015, Pozen entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger and Arrangement (the &#8220;Merger Agreement&#8221;), among Tribute, Aguono Limited (which was renamed Aralez Pharmaceuticals Limited and subsequently renamed Aralez Pharmaceuticals plc in connection with its re-registration as a public limited company), a limited company incorporated in Ireland (&#8220;Former Parent&#8221;), Trafwell Limited, a private limited company incorporated in Ireland, ARLZ US Acquisition Corp., a corporation incorporated under the laws of the State of Delaware and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Former Parent, and ARLZ CA Acquisition Corp., a corporation incorporated under the laws of the Province of Ontario and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Former Parent (&#8220;Can Merger Sub&#8221;) in order to effectuate the merger of Pozen and Tribute.&#160; On December 7, 2015, the Merger Agreement was amended, pursuant to which, among other things, (i) the Company replaced Former Parent as a party to the Merger Agreement, whereby, after giving effect to the merger transactions, the Company would be the ultimate parent company of the combined companies, (ii) ARLZ US Acquisition II Corp., a corporation formed under the laws of the State of Delaware, would be merged with and into Pozen, with Pozen continuing as the surviving corporation and an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, and (iii) Can Merger Sub and Tribute would amalgamate, with the separate legal existence of Can Merger Sub ceasing and Tribute and Can Merger Sub continuing as one corporation and as a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Primary Commercialized Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Products Marketed in the United States
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="F05F814C5BAE4255B4C0B0A649844115" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 10%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
	Fibricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	and Authorized Generic
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 90%; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX">
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In May 2015, we acquired the U.S. rights to Fibricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(fenofibric acid) and its related authorized generic.&#160; Fibricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is indicated as a complementary therapy along with diet for the treatment of severe hypertriglyceridemia and as a complementary therapy along with diet to reduce elevated low-density lipoprotein (&#8220;LDL&#8221;) cholesterol (&#8220;LDL-C&#8221;), total cholesterol (&#8220;Total-C&#8221;), triglycerides (&#8220;TG&#8221;), and apolipoprotein B (&#8220;Apo B&#8221;), and to increase high-density lipoprotein (&#8220;HDL&#8221;) cholesterol (&#8220;HDL-C&#8221;) in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia or mixed dyslipidemia.&#160; Fibricor is currently protected by four U.S. patents extending to August 20, 2027.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 3 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fibricor is a lipid-regulating agent available as tablets for oral administration.&#160; Fibrates like Fibricor, activate peroxisome proliferator activated receptor (&#8220;PPAR&#8221;) alpha, increasing the activity of lipoprotein lipase.&#160; This typically causes a decrease in triglyceride levels.&#160; PPAR alpha activation also increases HDL production.&#160; Each tablet contains 35mg or 105mg fenofibric acid, and the 35mg tablet is the lowest dose of fenofibric acid available in the United States.&#160; Fibricor is contraindicated in patients with severe renal impairment, active liver disease, liver function abnormalities, preexisting gallbladder disease or known hypersensitivity to fenofibric acid or fenofibrate.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Hyperlipidemia Treatment Options
</FONT>
	:&#160; Hyperlipidemia is a very common chronic condition and is characterized by an excess of fatty substances called lipids, mainly cholesterol and triglycerides, in the blood.&#160; It is also called hyperlipoproteinemia because these fatty substances travel in the blood attached to proteins.&#160; This is the only way that these fatty substances can remain dissolved while in circulation.&#160; Hyperlipidemia, in general, can be divided into two subcategories:&#160; (1) hypercholesterolemia, in which there is a high level of cholesterol; and (2) hypertriglyceridemia, in which there is a high level of triglycerides, the most common form of fat.&#160; In general, lifestyle modifications such as diet, exercise and smoking cessation are the first line of treatment.&#160; If unsuccessful, pharmacologic therapy is commonly utilized for the treatment of primary and secondary dyslipidemias.&#160; In managing secondary dyslipidemia, statin therapy is commonly prescribed.&#160; For the management of major triglyceride elevations, three agents are also commonly utilized:&#160; (1) fibric acid derivatives, such as Fibricor; (2) niacin; and (3) omega-3 fatty acids.&#160; Fibricor is approved in the United States and indicated as adjunctive therapy to diet for treatment of severe hypertriglyceridemia (TG &#8805; 500 mg/dL) and as adjunctive therapy to diet to reduce elevated LDL-C, Total-C, TG, and Apo B, and to increase HDL-C in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia or mixed dyslipidemia.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Cholesterol-lowering drugs in the United States include statins, niacin, bile-acid resins, fibric acid derivatives (fibrates), cholesterol absorption inhibitors, and anti-protein convertase subtilisin-like kexin type 9 (PCSK9) inhibitors.&#160; All classes of cholesterol-lowering medicines are most effective when combined with increased exercise and a low-fat, high-fiber diet.&#160; The statin class includes some of the largest-selling prescription products in the world (e.g., Lipitor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Zocor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	and Crestor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	).&#160; Statins dominate single-agent prescribing for the treatment of lipid disorders.&#160; The niacin (nicotinic acid &#8211; vitamin B3) class includes brands such as Niaspan
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, which work primarily on increasing HDL cholesterol.&#160; The cholesterol absorption inhibitor class has a single product, Zetia
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	.&#160; The PCSK9 inhibitor are a new class of treatments that currently include Praluent
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	and Repatha
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	TM
</SUP>
	.&#160; The fibrates class of cholesterol lowering treatments is composed of three competing molecules:&#160; (1) gemfibrozil (Lopid
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), (2) fenofibric acid (Fibricor, Trilipix
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), and (3) fenofibrate (Tricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	).&#160; The fibrate market in the United States was $2.4 billion for 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Products Marketed in Canada
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="DAE96F33075A4A4E9F57D80F027CA2C9" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Cambia
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; CLEAR: BOTH">
	&#174;
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; CLEAR: BOTH">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Cambia
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(diclofenac potassium for oral solution) is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (&#8220;NSAID&#8221;) and the only prescription NSAID available and approved in Canada for the acute treatment of migraine attacks with or without aura in adults 18 years of age or older.&#160; Cambia was licensed from Nautilus Neurosciences, Inc. (&#8220;Nautilus&#8221;) in November 2010.&#160; Cambia was approved by the FDA in June 2009 and is currently marketed by Depomed, Inc. (&#8220;Depomed&#8221;) in the United States.&#160; Cambia was approved by Health Canada in March 2012 and was commercially launched to specialists in Canada in October 2012 and broadly to all primary care physicians in February 2013.&#160; Depomed acquired Nautilus and the U.S. and Canadian rights to Cambia in December 2013.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 4 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Cambia is available as an oral solution in individual packets each designed to deliver a 50mg dose when mixed in water.&#160; Cambia is the only approved prescription NSAID available in Canada that was studied and proven to be an effective treatment for migraine according to guidelines published in September 2013 by the International Headache Society that reached statistically significant results for all four co-primary endpoints, including:&#160; (1) pain free response at two hours; (2) nausea free; (3) photophobia free (sensitivity to light); and (4) phonophobia free (sensitivity to sound).&#160; In addition, Cambia provides fast migraine pain relief within 30 minutes of dosing due in part to the significant benefits of the proprietary Dynamic Buffering Technology
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#8482;
</SUP>
	(&#8220;DBT&#8221;).&#160; DBT provides for enhanced drug absorption and bioavailability.&#160; In fasting volunteers, measurable plasma levels were observed within 5 minutes of dosing with Cambia.&#160; Peak plasma levels were achieved at approximately 15 minutes, with a range of approximately 10 to 40 minutes.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	NSAIDs, such as Cambia, may increase the incidence of cardiovascular adverse events such as myocardial infarction (&#8220;MI&#8221;), stroke or thrombotic events, gastrointestinal adverse events such as peptic/duodenal ulceration, perforation and gastrointestinal bleeding and are contraindicated in the third trimester of pregnancy.&#160; The risk may increase with duration of use and patients should only take this medication as prescribed by a physician.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Migraine Treatment Options in Canada
</FONT>
	:&#160; There are a number of different treatment options for migraine in Canada.&#160; Acute migraine treatment options can be broken down to three main categories: (i) triptans or 5-HT1 receptor agonists (e.g., sumatriptan, rizatriptan); (ii) ergot alkaloids (&#8220;ergots&#8221;) (e.g., ergotamine, dihydroergotamine); and (iii) NSAIDs (e.g., Cambia).&#160; Triptans may cause dizziness, nausea, weakness and chest discomfort and should not be used by patients with heart disease, uncontrolled high blood pressure, blood vessel disease or who have a history of stroke.&#160; Ergots may cause chest pain, tingling or burning sensations, nausea, vomiting, and cramps.&#160; Furthermore, ergots may reduce blood flow to the extremities (hands and feet) and may lead to tissue damage.&#160; Ergots should also not be used by anyone with heart disease, uncontrolled high blood pressure or blood vessel disease.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In September 2013, the Canadian Neurological Sciences Federation issued revised Canadian Headache Society Guidelines for Acute Drug Therapy for Migraine Headaches through the Canadian Journal of Neurological Sciences.&#160; Cambia was acknowledged as a potential first line therapy, with a fast onset of action and having a strong recommendation, high quality evidence and recommended for the acute treatment of migraine.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Migraine in Canada
</FONT>
	:&#160; Canadian studies have shown migraine prevalence rates of 23% to 26% in women, and 8% to 10% in men.&#160; Over 4,000,000 Canadians suffer from migraine in Canada and that 60% of those with migraine have one or more attacks per month while 25% of those with migraine have at least one attack per week.&#160; One Canadian study found that those with migraine lose 6.5 days of work each year resulting from their migraine and, as a result, migraine is associated with a substantial social and economic impact.&#160; A study done in 1990 calculated that 7,000,000 workdays are lost annually in Canada due to migraine.&#160; It was also found that 51% of all women suffering from migraine have never consulted a physician for their headaches.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; It is estimated that one-half of all people suffering from migraines in Canada never seek help from a physician but rather self-treat their condition with over-the-counter (&#8220;OTC&#8221;) medications such as aspirin (e.g., Bayer
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), acetaminophen (e.g., Tylenol
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) and OTC NSAID&#8217;s such as ibuprofen (e.g., Advil
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) and naproxen sodium (e.g., Aleve
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	).&#160; The main prescription pharmacological agents used to treat acute migraine includes the triptan class of drugs or 5-HT1 receptor agonists as they are known and these products include sumatriptan (Imitrex
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), rizatriptan (Maxalt
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), zolmitriptan (Zomig
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), almotriptan (Axert
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), naratriptan (Amerge
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), eletriptan (Relpax
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) and frovatriptan (Frova
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	).&#160; There are also the ergot alkaloids such as ergotamine (Cafergot
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) and dihydroergotamine (Migrinal
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) used in some cases as are narcotics such as meperidine (e.g., Demerol
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) and the combination drug of aspirin, butalbital and caffeine (e.g., Fiorinal).&#160; In spite of a number of possible treatment options for treating migraines, many of these treatments are without an authorized indication from Health Canada.&#160; The Company considers the competitive market as the triptans class, which currently sells approximately $125 million annually in Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 5 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="CC19009E40F049BFB0DD6A97DDC299F6" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Fiorinal
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	/Fiorinal
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	C
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fiorinal (acetylsalicylic acid, caffeine and butalbital tablets and capsules) and Fiorinal
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	C (acetylsalicylic acid, caffeine, butalbital and codeine capsules) were acquired from Novartis AG and Novartis Pharma AG in October 2014.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C were originally approved by Health Canada in 1970 for the relief of tension-type headache.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fiorinal is a fixed dose combination drug that combines the analgesic properties of acetylsalicylic acid, with the anxiolytic and muscle relaxant properties of butalbital, and the central nervous system stimulant properties of caffeine.&#160; Fiorinal C expands on the properties of Fiorinal with the additional analgesic effect of codeine.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C are the only prescription products in Canada indicated for relief of tension type headaches.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C are currently marketed in Canada in hard gelatin capsules containing 330mg acetylsalicylic acid, 40mg caffeine, 50mg butalbital, and in the case of Fiorinal C, the addition or 15mg or 30mg of codeine.&#160; Codeine and butalbital are both habit-forming and potentially abusable.&#160; Consequently, the extended use of Fiorinal or Fiorinal C is not recommended.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C are associated with exacerbation of headache (medication overuse headaches) in susceptible patients.&#160; Repeated use of Fiorinal and Fiorinal C can lead to &#8220;rebound&#8221; headaches as each dose wears off.&#160; With repeated doses physical and psychological dependence can develop.&#160; In addition to dependence, butalbital-containing products can lead to tolerance, and at higher doses can produce withdrawal symptoms after discontinuation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Tension-Type Headache in Canada
</FONT>
	:&#160; Tension-type headaches are the most common type of headache and are caused by muscle tightening in the back of the neck or scalp.&#160; These headaches are typically triggered by emotional stress, fatigue or depression.&#160; There are two classifications of tension-type headache: (1) episodic tension headaches, which occur randomly and less frequently; and (2) chronic tension headaches, which may occur daily or continually and the intensity of the pain may vary during a 24-hour cycle.&#160; Tension headaches differ from migraine headaches due to the lack of aura, photophobia, phonophobia and/or nausea.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Tension-type headaches may be treated with OTC NSAIDs like Tylenol
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Advil
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Aleve
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, or Aspirin
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	.&#160; Prescription NSAIDs may also be used, such as Naprosyn
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Anaprox
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Toradol
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, as well as prescription analgesic/opiate combinations like Percocet
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Tylenol
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	with codeine and Fiorinal/Fiorinal C.&#160; In spite of a number of possible treatment options for treating tension-type headaches, all of these treatments, with the exception of Fiorinal and Fiorinal C, are without an authorized indication from Health Canada.&#160; The Company considers the competitive market as the prescription NSAID and prescription analgesic/opiate combination class, which has an estimated tension-type headache value of approximately $30 million annually in Canada.&#160; The OTC market for tension-type headache is estimated to be exponentially larger given the large patient population; however, the true value is extremely difficult to determine considering the broad range of indications for OTC NSAIDs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="62F8B16118FD4449B65DECD9AB15932B" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#174;
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Soriatane (acitretin) is chemically known as acitretin, and is indicated for the treatment of severe psoriasis (including erythrodermic and pustular types) and other disorders of keratinization.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is a retinoid, an aromatic analog of vitamin A.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	was approved in Canada in 1994 and is the first and only oral retinoid indicated for psoriasis.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is often used when milder forms of psoriasis treatments like topical steroids, emollients and topical tar-based therapies have failed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 6 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	should be reserved for patients unresponsive to, or intolerant of, standard treatment.&#160; In addition, Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	should only be prescribed by physicians knowledgeable in the use of systemic retinoids.&#160; Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	is teratogenic (can cause birth defects) and should not be used by women who are pregnant or who are planning to become pregnant during, or within three years after stopping, treatment of Soriatane.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	&#160; In addition, acitretin may cause nausea, headache, itching, dry, red or flaky skin, dry or red eyes, dry or chapped lips, swollen lips, dry mouth, thirst, cystitis acne or hair loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Psoriasis Treatment Options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	:&#160; There are a number of different treatment options for psoriasis.&#160; Typically, topical agents are used for mild disease, phototherapy for moderate disease and oral systemic agents and biologicals for more severe disease.&#160; The three main traditional systemic treatments are (1) methotrexate, (2) cyclosporine and (3) retinoids.&#160; Unlike Soriatane, methotrexate and cyclosporine are immunosuppressant drugs.&#160; Methotrexate may cause a decrease in the number of blood cells made by bone marrow, may cause liver damage, lung damage, damage to the lining of the mouth, stomach or intestines and may increase the risk of developing lymphoma (cancer that begins in the cells of the immune system), among other serious side effects
</FONT>
	.&#160; Methotrexate may also cause serious or life-threatening skin reactions.&#160; Cyclosporines may cause side effects that could be very serious, such as high blood pressure and kidney and liver problems.&#160; It may also reduce the body&#8217;s ability to fight infections.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Severe psoriasis is a condition that involves more than 10% of the body area or is physically, occupationally or psychologically disabling.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	will typically be used in combination with other drugs such as topical steroids, emollients or tar-based therapies.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is most effective for treating psoriasis when it is used with phototherapy.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	may be used with biologic agents, such as etanercept (Enbrel
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), adalimumab (Humira
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) or infliximab (Remicade
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), and may also be prescribed in rotation with cyclosporine or methotrexate.&#160; Biologic therapies such as Enbrel
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, Humira
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	and Remicade
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	are effective in treating severe forms of the disease, but tend to be very expensive and sometimes not reimbursed by government or other private drug plans.&#160; Cyclosporine and methotrexate are also oral agents that are often used for severe forms of psoriasis.&#160; The market for moderate to severe psoriasis in Canada, including the biologics, is estimated to be greater than $200 million for 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="C32D97531A6246B8BCF0CED672A04722" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Bezalip
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	SR
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Bezalip SR (bezafibrate) is an established pan-peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor activator.&#160; Bezalip SR, used to treat hyperlipidemia (high cholesterol), has over 25 years of therapeutic use globally.&#160; Bezalip SR helps lower LDL-C and triglycerides while raising HDL-C levels.&#160; It also improves insulin sensitivity and reduces blood glucose levels, which in combination with the cholesterol effects may significantly lower the incidence of cardiovascular events and development of diabetes in patients with features of metabolic syndrome.&#160; Bezalip SR is contraindicated in patients with hepatic and renal impairment, pre-existing gallbladder disease, hypersensitivity to bezafibrate, or pregnancy or lactation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Bezalip SR is currently approved in more than 40 countries worldwide, not including the United States.&#160; Bezalip SR is under license from Actavis Group PTC (&#8220;Actavis&#8221;), and we have the exclusive rights to market Bezalip SR in Canada.&#160; We also have the exclusive development and licensing rights to Bezalip SR in the United States and filed an Investigational New Drug (&#8220;IND&#8221;) that received clearance from the FDA in the United States.&#160; Clinical studies would be required prior to commercialization in the United States.&#160; The initial target indication that would be considered for pursuit in the United States is for severe hypertriglyceridemia.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 7 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Hyperlipidemia Treatment Options
</FONT>
	:&#160; Hyperlipidemia is a very common chronic condition and is characterized by an excess of fatty substances called lipids, mainly cholesterol and triglycerides, in the blood.&#160; It is also called hyperlipoproteinemia because these fatty substances travel in the blood attached to proteins.&#160; This is the only way that these fatty substances can remain dissolved while in circulation.&#160; Hyperlipidemia, in general, can be divided into two subcategories:&#160; (1) hypercholesterolemia, in which there is a high level of cholesterol; and (2) hypertriglyceridemia, in which there is a high level of triglycerides, the most common form of fat.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Cholesterol-lowering drugs in Canada include statins, niacin, bile-acid resins, fibric acid derivatives (fibrates), and cholesterol absorption inhibitors.&#160; All classes of cholesterol-lowering medicines are most effective when combined with increased exercise and a low-fat, high-fiber diet.&#160; The statin class includes some of the largest-selling prescription products in the world (e.g., atorvastatin (Lipitor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), simvastatin (Zocor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	) and rosuvastatin (Crestor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	)).&#160; Statins dominate single-agent prescribing for the treatment of lipid disorders.&#160; The niacin (nicotinic acid &#8211; vitamin B3) class includes brands such as Niaspan
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, which work primarily on increasing HDL cholesterol.&#160; The fibrates class of cholesterol-lowering treatments is composed of three competing molecules:&#160; (1) gemfibrozil (Lopid
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	), (2) bezafibrate (Bezalip SR), and (3) fenofibrate (Lipidil
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	in Canada or Tricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	in the United States).&#160; Clinical studies have demonstrated that bezafibrate, the active ingredient in Bezalip SR, was shown to be effective in lowering high levels of triglycerides, raising HDL cholesterol and lowering LDL cholesterol.&#160; As of the end of 2015, the annual fibrate market in Canada is estimated to be approximately $35 million.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Other Commercialized Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In addition to the products discussed above, we also market NeoVisc
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(sodium hylauronic solution - 1%), Uracyst
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(sodium chondroitin sulfate - 2%), Durela
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(tramadol hydrochloride), Proferrin
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(heme iron polypeptide), Resultz
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	(isopropyl myristate), Collatamp
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	G (collagen-gentamycin) and a portfolio of eight products targeted in the gastroenterology and women&#8217;s health markets in Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Primary Development Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="07015D19CA824DCEA36ED1EF5F1C5866" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	YOSPRALA
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#8482;
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The products in the YOSPRALA (aspirin/omeprazole delayed release tablets) portfolio, which are part of our proton pump inhibitor (&#8220;PPI&#8221;)-aspirin (&#8220;PA&#8221;) platform, are being developed with the goal of significantly reducing gastrointestinal (&#8220;GI&#8221;) ulcers and other GI complications compared to taking enteric-coated, buffered or plain aspirin alone in patients at risk of developing GI ulcers.&#160; The first candidates in the YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	product portfolio are YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	81/40 (PA8140), which contains 81mg of enteric-coated aspirin and 40mg immediate-release omeprazole, and YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	325/40 (PA32540), which contains 325mg of enteric-coated aspirin and 40mg immediate-release omeprazole.&#160; Both products are a coordinated-delivery tablet combining immediate-release omeprazole, a PPI, layered around a pH-sensitive enteric coating of an aspirin core.&#160; This novel, patented product is intended for oral administration once a day.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Pending FDA review and approval, YOSPRALA 81/40 and 325/40 would be indicated for patients who require aspirin (1) to reduce the combined risk of death and nonfatal stroke in patients who have had ischemic stroke or transient ischemia of the brain due to fibrin platelet emboli, (2) to reduce the combined risk of death and nonfatal MI in patients with a previous MI or unstable angina pectoris, (3) to reduce the combined risk of MI and sudden death in patients with chronic stable angina pectoris, (4) for a pre-existing condition after having undergone revascularization procedures, and (5) the omeprazole component, to decrease the risk of developing gastric ulcers in patients at risk for developing aspirin-associated gastric ulcers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 8 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
