<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM3_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 3.&#160; Legal Proceedings
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	VIMOVO
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	ANDA Litigation
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Between March 14, 2011 and May 16, 2013, we received Paragraph IV Notice Letters from Dr. Reddy&#8217;s Laboratories (&#8220;DRL&#8221;), Lupin Ltd. (&#8220;Lupin&#8221;), Watson Laboratories, Inc. &#8211; Florida (&#8220;Watson&#8221;), and Mylan Pharmaceuticals Inc. (&#8220;Mylan&#8221;), stating that each had filed an ANDA with the FDA seeking regulatory approval to market a generic version of our VIMOVO product before the expiration of U.S. Patent No. 6,926,907 (the &#8220;&#8216;907 patent&#8221;).&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	On November 20, 2012,
</FONT>
	we
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	received a second Notice Letter from DRL
</FONT>
	stating
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	that DRL had filed a second ANDA with the FDA
</FONT>
	seeking regulatory approval to market a different generic formulation of the VIMOVO product before the expiration of the &#8216;907 patent
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
	The &#8216;907 patent is assigned to POZEN and listed for the VIMOVO product in the FDA&#8217;s publication titled &#8220;Approved Drug Products with Therapeutic Equivalence Evaluations&#8221; (also known as the &#8220;Orange Book&#8221;).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On April 21, 2011, we filed suit against the first ANDA filer, DRL, in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	(the &#8220;District Court&#8221;), asserting infringement of the
</FONT>
	&#8216;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	907 patent.&#160; We subsequently filed suit against the other three ANDA filers within 45 days of receipt of their respective Paragraph IV Notice Letters.&#160; Horizon, our current marketing partner for
</FONT>
	the VIMOVO product
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	, is our co-plaintiff in each suit.
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	The first suit against DRL is considered the lead case and has been consolidated with other suits for the purpose of pre-trial and discovery.&#160; On December 19, 2012, the District Court conducted a pre-trial Markman hearing to determine the proper claim construction of certain claims disputed by the parties.&#160; On May 1, 2013, the District Court issued a Markman Order construing the disputed claims.&#160; A scheduling order for the consolidated suits was issued by the District Court on June 27, 2014.&#160; Fact discovery closed in the consolidated suits on November 20, 2014, expert discovery closed on June 25, 2015, and we are currently waiting for the District Court to set a trial date (which has been delayed in part due to the retirement of the presiding judge in the case, the Honorable Joel A. Pisano).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On October 15, 2013, the United States Patent &amp; Trademark Office (&#8220;USPTO&#8221;) issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 8,557,285 (the &#8220;&#8216;285 patent&#8221;).&#160; The &#8216;285 patent is listed in the Orange Book for the VIMOVO product and is related to the &#8216;907 patent.&#160; On October 23, 2013, we filed suits against DRL, Lupin, Watson and Mylan in the District Court asserting infringement of the &#8216;285 patent.&#160; These suits have each been consolidated with the above referenced suits involving the &#8216;907 patent
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On October 7, 2014, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 8,852,636 (the &#8220;&#8216;636 patent&#8221;).&#160; On October 14, 2014, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 8,858,996 (the &#8220;&#8216;996 patent&#8221;).&#160; In addition, on October 21, 2014, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 8,865,190 (the &#8220;&#8216;190 patent&#8221;).&#160; The &#8216;636, &#8216;996 and &#8216;190 patents are each listed in the Orange Book for the VIMOVO product and are each related to the &#8216;907 and &#8216;285 patents.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On February 3, 2015, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 8,945,621 (the &#8220;&#8216;621 patent&#8221;).&#160; The &#8216;621 patent is listed in the Orange Book for the VIMOVO product.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On May 13, 2015, the Company and Horizon filed suit against DRL, Lupin, Actavis (formerly known as Watson) and Mylan in the District Court asserting infringement of the &#8216;636 and &#8216;996 patents.&#160; On June 18, 2015, we filed Amended Complaints in each of the suits to assert infringement of the &#8216;190 patent.&#160; In its responsive pleading, Actavis filed a counterclaim alleging that its generic product does not infringe the &#8216;621 patent and that the &#8216;621 patent is invalid.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 55 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On October 20, 2015, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 9,161,920 (the &#8220;&#8216;920 patent&#8221;).&#160; On December 1, 2015, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 9,198,888 (the &#8220;&#8216;888 patent&#8221;).&#160; The &#8216;920 and &#8216;888 patents are each listed in the Orange Book for the VIMOVO product and are each related to the &#8216;907 and &#8216;285 patents.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On December 29, 2015, the USPTO issued to the Company U.S. Patent No. 9,220,698 (the &#8220;&#8216;698 patent&#8221;).&#160; The &#8216;698 patent is listed in the Orange Book for the VIMOVO product.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On January 25, 2016, the Company and Horizon filed suit against Actavis in the District Court asserting infringement of the &#8216;920 and &#8216;888 patents.&#160; Actavis has not yet filed a responsive pleading.&#160; On February 10, 2015, we filed Amended Complaints against DRL, Lupin and Mylan to assert infringement of the &#8216;920 and &#8216;888 patents.&#160; In its responsive pleading, Mylan filed a counterclaim alleging that its generic product does not infringe the &#8216;698 patent and that the &#8216;698 patent is invalid.&#160; These suits are in the initial phase and a full schedule has not yet been set by the District Court.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Inter Partes
</FONT>
	Review
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	DRL filed a Petition for (&#8220;IPR Petition&#8221;) of the &#8216;285 patent with the Patent Trial and Appeal Board (&#8220;PTAB&#8221;) of the USPTO on February 24, 2015, which was denied on October 9, 2015.&#160; The Coalition for Affordable Drugs VII L.L.C. (&#8220;CFAD&#8221;) filed IPR Petitions of the &#8216;907 patent, the &#8216;996 patent and the &#8216;636 patent with the PTAB on May 21, 2015, June 5, 2014 and August 7, 2015, respectively, each of which was denied on December 8, 2015, December 17, 2015 and February 11, 2016, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On August 12, 2015, CFAD filed an IPR Petition of the &#8216;621 patent with the PTAB.&#160; On February 22, 2016 the PTAB instituted review of the claims of the &#8216;621 patent.&#160; The Company and Horizon have until May 23, 2016 to file a response to the petition.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On August 19, 2015, Lupin filed three separate IPR Petitions of the &#8216;996, &#8216;636 and &#8216;190 patents with the PTAB.&#160; On March 1, 2016 the PTAB denied Lupin&#8217;s petition for review of the &#8216;636 patent and instituted review of&#160;a limited number of the claims in each&#160;of the &#8216;996 and &#8216;190 patents.&#160; The Company and Horizon have until May 27, 2016 to file responses to the petitions for review of the &#8216;996 and &#8216;190 patents.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On November 12, 2015, Gray Square Pharmaceuticals, LLC (formerly known as Graybar Pharmaceuticals, LLC) filed an IPR Petition of U.S. Patent No. 7,332,183 (the &#8220;&#8216;183 patent&#8221;) with the PTAB.&#160; The &#8216;183 patent is assigned to POZEN and listed with respect to Treximet in the Orange Book.&#160; The Company and our marketing partner Pernix Therapeutics Holdings, Inc. filed a Preliminary Response to Gray Square&#8217;s petition on February 16, 2016.&#160; Upon receipt of such a Preliminary Response, the PTAB has three months in which to institute or deny the IPR proceeding.&#160; If the PTAB decides to institute the IPR proceeding, Gray Square will have the opportunity to challenge the validity of the &#8216;183 patent in whole or in part before the PTAB via a patent validity trial.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 56 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Canada VIMOVO
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Litigation
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On January 20, 2015, our Canadian licensee, AstraZeneca Canada Inc. (&#8220;AstraZeneca Canada&#8221;) received a Notice of Allegation from Mylan Canada informing that Mylan Canada has filed an Abbreviated New Drug Submission in Canada for approval of its naproxen/esomeprazole magnesium tablets and alleging non-infringement of some of the claims and invalidity of Canadian Patent No. 2,449,098 (the &#8220;&#8216;098 patent&#8221;).&#160; A Notice of Allegation is served pursuant to the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations in Canada and is similar to a Paragraph IV Notice Letter in the United States, and in response, we and AstraZeneca Canada commenced a proceeding in the Federal Court of Canada (the &#8220;Canada Court&#8221;) in relation to the &#8216;098 patent on March 5, 2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	seeking to prohibit Health Canada from approving Mylan Canada&#8217;s generic naproxen/esomeprazole product.&#160; The Canadian proceeding is summary in nature and expected to be completed before March 5, 2017.&#160; In accordance with the schedule approved by the Canada Court, affidavit evidence of AstraZeneca Canada and the Company was served on September 11, 2015 and affidavit evidence of Mylan Canada on January 8, 2016.&#160; The parties are to complete cross-examinations on the affidavit evidence by April 29, 2016.&#160; The written records for the hearing are to be served by AstraZeneca Canada and us by July 4, 2016 and by Mylan Canada by September 2, 2016.&#160; A three-day hearing of the matter has been scheduled, commencing on November 21, 2016.&#160; The proceeding will decide whether approval for Mylan Canada&#8217;s naproxen/esomeprazole magnesium tablets will be prohibited until the expiry of the &#8216;098 patent because none of Mylan Canada&#8217;s allegations in respect of the &#8216;098 patent are justified, however the proceeding will not finally decide &#8216;098 patent validity or infringement.&#160; The &#8216;098 patent expires on May 31, 2022.
</DIV>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<EFX_MARKET>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Market Information
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As a result of the Tribute Transaction, all of the shares of Pozen common stock issued and outstanding immediately prior to the effective time of the Tribute Transaction were canceled and automatically converted into and became the right to receive our common shares on a one-for-one basis and Pozen became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Aralez.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our common shares began trading on the NASDAQ Global Market under the trading symbol &#8220;ARLZ&#8221; on February 8, 2016 and on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the trading symbol &#8220;ARZ&#8221; on February 10, 2016.&#160; Previously, from October 11, 2000 until February 5, 2016, the common stock of Pozen was traded on the NASDAQ Global Market (formerly the NASDAQ National Market) under the trading symbol &#8220;POZN.&#8221;&#160; The following table sets forth the high and low sales prices per share of common stock of Pozen as reported on the NASDAQ Global Market for the periods indicated.

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Holders of Record
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The closing price of our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	common shares as reported on the
</FONT>
	NASDAQ Global Market and the Toronto Stock Exchange on March 8, 2016 was $5.94 and C$7.98, respectively.&#160; As of the close of business on March 8, 2016, there were approximately 108 holders of record of our common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Dividends
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Except for the $1.75 per share special cash distribution on December 30, 2013 (representing a surplus of corporate cash and accounted for as a return of capital to stockholders), Pozen has not declared or paid any cash dividends on shares of Pozen common stock.&#160; We have not declared or paid any cash dividends on common shares to date.&#160; We currently intend to retain all earnings to support operations and do not intend to pay cash dividends on our common shares for the foreseeable future.&#160; In addition, our ability to pay cash dividends is currently prohibited by the Facility Agreement, subject to certain exceptions.&#160; Any future determination to pay dividends on our common shares will be at the sole discretion of the board of directors and will depend on, among other things, the Company&#8217;s results of operations, current and anticipated cash requirements and surplus, financial condition, contractual restrictions and financing agreement covenants, solvency tests imposed by corporate law and other factors that the board of directors may deem relevant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 58 -
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Restrictions on Share Ownership by Non-Canadians
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	There are no limitations under the laws of Canada or in our organizational documents on the right of foreigners to hold or vote our securities, except that the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Investment Canada Act
</FONT>
	(Canada) (the &#8220;Investment Canada Act&#8221;) may require review and approval by the Minister of Innovation, Science and Economic Development (Canada) of certain acquisitions of &#8220;control&#8221; of the Company by a &#8220;non-Canadian.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Investment Canada Act
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	An acquisition of control of a Canadian business by a non-Canadian is either reviewable (a &#8220;Reviewable Transaction&#8221;), in which case it is subject to both a reporting obligation and an approval process, or notifiable, in which case it is subject to only a reporting obligation.&#160; In the case of a Reviewable Transaction, the non-Canadian acquirer must submit an application for review with the prescribed information.&#160; The responsible Minister is then required to determine whether the Reviewable Transaction is likely to be of net benefit to Canada, taking into account the assessment factors specified in the Investment Canada Act and any written undertakings that may have been given by the non-Canadian acquirer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Any investment by a non-Canadian in a Canadian business, even where control has not been acquired, can be reviewed on grounds of whether it may be injurious to national security.&#160; Where an investment is determined to be injurious to national security, Canada&#8217;s Cabinet can prohibit closing or, if closed, can order the investor to divest control.&#160; Short of a prohibition or divestment order, Canada&#8217;s Cabinet can impose terms or conditions on the investment or can require the investor to provide binding undertakings to remove the national security concern.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Competition Act
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Part IX of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competition Act
</FONT>
	(Canada) (the &#8220;Competition Act&#8221;) requires that pre-merger notification filings be submitted to the Commissioner of Competition (the &#8220;Commissioner&#8221;) in respect of certain types of transactions that exceed certain prescribed thresholds.&#160; If a proposed transaction exceeds such thresholds, subject to certain exceptions, notification filings must be submitted to the Commissioner and the statutory waiting period must expire or be terminated early or waived by the Commissioner before the transaction can be completed.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	All mergers, regardless of whether they are subject to Part IX of the Competition Act, are subject to the substantive mergers provisions under Section 92 of the Competition Act.&#160; In particular, the Commissioner may challenge a transaction before the Competition Tribunal where the transaction prevents or lessens, or is likely to prevent or lessen, competition substantially in a market.&#160; The Commissioner may not make an application to the Competition Tribunal under Section 92 of the Competition Act more than one year after the transaction has been substantially completed.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Stock Performance Graph
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The graph below matches Pozen&#8217;s cumulative five-year total shareholder return on common stock with the cumulative total returns of the NASDAQ Composite Index, the NASDAQ Pharmaceutical Index, and the NASDAQ Biotechnology Index.&#160; The graph tracks the performance of a $100 investment in Pozen&#8217;s common stock and in each index (with the reinvestment of all dividends) from December 31, 2010 to December 31, 2015.

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<U>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM7_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 7.&#160; Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our Business
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Aralez is a global specialty pharmaceutical company focused on delivering meaningful products to improve patients&#8217; lives while focusing on creating shareholder value by acquiring, developing and commercializing products primarily in cardiovascular, pain and other specialty areas.&#160; Aralez&#8217;s global headquarters is located in Ontario, Canada, its U.S. headquarters&#160;is in&#160;New York, New York&#160;and its Irish headquarters is located in Dublin, Ireland.&#160; Aralez was formed for the purpose of facilitating the business combination of Pozen and Tribute, which business combination was consummated on February 5, 2016.&#160; Aralez has had no operations as of December 31, 2015, other than business incident to the Tribute Transaction.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our management team has a strong track record of success in creating, leading and expanding specialty pharmaceutical companies with marketing and sales capabilities.&#160; Directed by this leadership and leveraging our competitive platform, our focus on acquiring high potential growth opportunities through aggressive business development and licensing and strategic M&amp;A and commercializing healthcare products to provide enhanced value to a range of stakeholders is driven by the following primary strategies:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="15EFCE8531204B6987C35C70CE8E9B98" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Maximize value of expanded portfolio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#8211; We plan to continue our progress toward building out our U.S. commercial organization, including growing our sales force and promoting the use of Fibricor in the United States to grow product use moderately in the United States and which we expect will develop a relationship springboard with cardiologists ahead of the anticipated approval and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	commercial launch of YOSPRALA.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="A1EFE53A513C445ABEBDBCDD906F8CCB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Business development through selective acquisitions
</FONT>
	&#8211; We have completed numerous transactions over the past few years to expand our portfolio offering.&#160; We will continue to pursue value-driven business development opportunities as they arise and enhance our product pipeline and expand our geographic footprint through strategically acquiring low-risk, revenue generating product candidates or approved products, particularly in the cardiovascular and pain anchor areas, but also in other specialty therapeutic areas that we anticipate are or will become revenue generating and accretive.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="5811DDB778B448459B7FDDB27A4DB697" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#9679;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Leverage platform for growth
</FONT>
	&#8211; We intend to maintain a lean, nimble and performance-oriented operating model with strong financial discipline.&#160; Our well-capitalized financial profile provides us with ample liquidity to commercialize YOSPRALA, if and when approved, and creates the opportunity for sustained long-term growth, both organically and through acquisitions, while also enabling us to have an ongoing focus on growing shareholder value.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On February 5, 2016, pursuant to the Merger Agreement, Aralez completed the acquisition of Tribute by way of a court approved plan of arrangement in a stock transaction with an estimated purchase price of $138 million made up of (i) $115 million related to Tribute shares, equity awards and certain warrants outstanding and (ii) $23 million in repayments of Tribute indebtedness.&#160; In connection with the Tribute Transaction, Pozen and Tribute were combined under and became subsidiaries of Aralez Pharmaceuticals Inc., with Pozen treated as the acquiring company for accounting purposes.&#160; Pursuant to Rule 12g-3(a) under the Exchange Act, Aralez Pharmaceuticals Inc. is the successor issuer to Pozen.&#160; The Tribute Transaction provides the combined company with increased financial strength and product portfolio diversity and is expected to meaningfully accelerate our operating strategies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 62 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have incurred significant losses since our inception and have not yet generated significant revenue from product sales.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, Pozen&#8217;s accumulated deficit was approximately $134.7 million.&#160; We record revenue under the following categories: royalty revenues and licensing revenues.&#160; Our licensing revenues include upfront payments upon contract signing and additional payments if and when certain milestones in the product&#8217;s development or commercialization are reached, while the royalty payments are based on product sales.&#160; Our historical operating losses have resulted principally from our research and development activities, including clinical trial activities for our product candidates and selling, general and administrative expenses.&#160; Research and development expenses include salaries and benefits for personnel involved in our research and development activities and direct development costs, which include costs relating to the formulation and manufacturing of our product candidates, costs relating to preclinical studies, including toxicology studies, and clinical trials, and costs relating to compliance with regulatory requirements applicable to the development of our product candidates.&#160; Since inception, Pozen&#8217;s research and development expenses have represented approximately 59% of our total operating expenses.&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2015, Pozen&#8217;s research and development expenses represented approximately 14% of our total operating expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Status and Expenses Related to Our Approved Products and Product Candidates
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	There follows a brief discussion of the status of the development of our approved products and our product candidates, as well as the costs relating to our development activities.&#160; Pozen&#8217;s direct research and development expenses were $5.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, $3.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, and $6.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2013.&#160; Our research and development expenses that are not direct development costs consist of personnel and other research and development departmental costs and are not allocated by product candidate.&#160; We generally do not maintain records that allocate our employees&#8217; time by the projects on which they work and, therefore, are unable to identify costs related to the time that employees spend on research and development by product candidate.&#160; Total compensation and benefit costs for Pozen&#8217;s personnel involved in research and development were $2.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, $2.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2014, and $3.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2013.&#160; Total compensation included $0.2 million, $0.3 million, and a $0.8 million charge for non-cash stock-based compensation expense for the years ended December 31, 2015, December 31, 2014, and December 31, 2013, respectively.&#160; Other Pozen research and development department costs were $0.3 million, $0.1 million, and $0.2 million for the years ended December 31, 2015, December 31, 2014, and December 31, 2013, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Primary Commercialized Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Products Marketed in the United States
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="703F1869473043F985E700698B1F32B6" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Fibricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	and Authorized Generic
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In May 2015, we acquired the U.S. rights to Fibricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(fenofibric acid) and its related authorized generic.&#160; Fibricor
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is indicated as a complementary therapy along with diet for the treatment of severe hypertriglyceridemia and as a complementary therapy along with diet to reduce elevated LDL-C, Total-C, TG, and Apo B, and to increase HDL-C in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia or mixed dyslipidemia.&#160; Fibricor is currently protected by four U.S. patents extending to August 20, 2027.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fibricor is a lipid-regulating agent available as tablets for oral administration.&#160; Fibrates like Fibricor, activate PPAR alpha, increasing the activity of lipoprotein lipase.&#160; This typically causes a decrease in triglyceride levels.&#160; PPAR alpha activation also increases HDL production.&#160; Each tablet contains 35mg or 105mg fenofibric acid, and the 35mg tablet is the lowest dose of fenofibric acid available in the United States.&#160; Fibricor is contraindicated in patients with severe renal impairment, active liver disease, liver function abnormalities, preexisting gallbladder disease or known hypersensitivity to fenofibric acid or fenofibrate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 63 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Hyperlipidemia Treatment Options
</FONT>
	:&#160; Hyperlipidemia is a very common chronic condition and is characterized by an excess of fatty substances called lipids, mainly cholesterol and triglycerides, in the blood.&#160; It is also called hyperlipoproteinemia because these fatty substances travel in the blood attached to proteins.&#160; This is the only way that these fatty substances can remain dissolved while in circulation.&#160; Hyperlipidemia, in general, can be divided into two subcategories:&#160; (1) hypercholesterolemia, in which there is a high level of cholesterol; and (2) hypertriglyceridemia, in which there is a high level of triglycerides, the most common form of fat.&#160; In general, lifestyle modifications such as diet, exercise and smoking cessation are the first line of treatment.&#160; If unsuccessful, pharmacologic therapy is commonly utilized for the treatment of primary and secondary dyslipidemias.&#160; In managing secondary dyslipidemia, statin therapy is commonly prescribed.&#160; For the management of major triglyceride elevations, three agents are also commonly utilized:&#160; (1) fibric acid derivatives, such as Fibricor; (2) niacin; and (3) omega-3 fatty acids.&#160; Fibricor is approved in the United States and indicated as adjunctive therapy to diet for treatment of severe hypertriglyceridemia (TG &#8805; 500 mg/dL) and as adjunctive therapy to diet to reduce elevated LDL-C, Total-C, TG, and Apo B, and to increase HDL-C in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia or mixed dyslipidemia.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Cholesterol-lowering drugs in the United States include statins, niacin, bile-acid resins, fibric acid derivatives (fibrates), cholesterol absorption inhibitors, and anti-protein convertase subtilisin-like kexin type 9 (PCSK9) inhibitors.&#160; All classes of cholesterol-lowering medicines are most effective when combined with increased exercise and a low-fat, high-fiber diet.&#160; The statin class includes some of the largest-selling prescription products in the world (e.g., Lipitor, Zocor and Crestor).&#160; Statins dominate single-agent prescribing for the treatment of lipid disorders.&#160; The niacin (nicotinic acid &#8211; vitamin B3) class includes brands such as Niaspan, which work primarily on increasing HDL cholesterol.&#160; The cholesterol absorption inhibitor class has a single product, Zetia.&#160; The PCSK9 inhibitor are a new class of treatments that currently include Praluent and Repatha.&#160; The fibrates class of cholesterol lowering treatments is composed of three competing molecules:&#160; (1) gemfibrozil (Lopid), (2) fenofibric acid (Fibricor, Trilipix), and (3) fenofibrate (Tricor).&#160; The fibrate market in the United States was $2.4 billion for 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Products Marketed in Canada
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="5C08234C37DC4793AD9A9F65EA30CB3D" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cambia
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Cambia
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(diclofenac potassium for oral solution) is an NSAID and the only prescription NSAID available and approved in Canada for the acute treatment of migraine attacks with or without aura in adults 18 years of age or older.&#160; Cambia was licensed from Nautilus in November 2010.&#160; Cambia was approved by the FDA in June 2009 and is currently marketed by Depomed in the United States.&#160; Cambia was approved by Health Canada in March 2012 and was commercially launched to specialists in Canada in October 2012 and broadly to all primary care physicians in February 2013.&#160; Depomed acquired Nautilus and the U.S. and Canadian rights to Cambia in December 2013.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 64 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Cambia is available as an oral solution in individual packets each designed to deliver a 50mg dose when mixed in water.&#160; Cambia is the only approved prescription NSAID available in Canada that was studied and proven to be an effective treatment for migraine according to guidelines published in September 2013 by the International Headache Society that reached statistically significant results for all four co-primary endpoints, including:&#160; (1) pain free response at two hours; (2) nausea free; (3) photophobia free (sensitivity to light); and (4) phonophobia free (sensitivity to sound).&#160; In addition, Cambia provides fast migraine pain relief within 30 minutes of dosing due in part to the significant benefits of the proprietary DBT.&#160; DBT provides for enhanced drug absorption and bioavailability.&#160; In fasting volunteers, measurable plasma levels were observed within 5 minutes of dosing with Cambia.&#160; Peak plasma levels were achieved at approximately 15 minutes, with a range of approximately 10 to 40 minutes.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	NSAIDs, such as Cambia, may increase the incidence of cardiovascular adverse events such as MI, stroke or thrombotic events, gastrointestinal adverse events such as peptic/duodenal ulceration, perforation and gastrointestinal bleeding and are contraindicated in the third trimester of pregnancy.&#160; The risk may increase with duration of use and patients should only take this medication as prescribed by a physician.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Migraine Treatment Options in Canada
</FONT>
	:&#160; There are a number of different treatment options for migraine in Canada.&#160; Acute migraine treatment options can be broken down to three main categories: (i) triptans or 5-HT1 receptor agonists (e.g., sumatriptan, rizatriptan); (ii) ergots (e.g., ergotamine, dihydroergotamine); and (iii) NSAIDs (e.g., Cambia).&#160; Triptans may cause dizziness, nausea, weakness and chest discomfort and should not be used by patients with heart disease, uncontrolled high blood pressure, blood vessel disease or who have a history of stroke.&#160; Ergots may cause chest pain, tingling or burning sensations, nausea, vomiting, and cramps.&#160; Furthermore, ergots may reduce blood flow to the extremities (hands and feet) and may lead to tissue damage.&#160; Ergots should also not be used by anyone with heart disease, uncontrolled high blood pressure or blood vessel disease.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In September 2013, the Canadian Neurological Sciences Federation issued revised Canadian Headache Society Guidelines for Acute Drug Therapy for Migraine Headaches through the Canadian Journal of Neurological Sciences.&#160; Cambia was acknowledged as a potential first line therapy, with a fast onset of action and having a strong recommendation, high quality evidence and recommended for the acute treatment of migraine.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Migraine in Canada
</FONT>
	:&#160; Canadian studies have shown migraine prevalence rates of 23% to 26% in women, and 8% to 10% in men.&#160; Over 4,000,000 Canadians suffer from migraine in Canada and that 60% of those with migraine have one or more attacks per month while 25% of those with migraine have at least one attack per week.&#160; One Canadian study found that those with migraine lose 6.5 days of work each year resulting from their migraine and, as a result, migraine is associated with a substantial social and economic impact.&#160; A study done in 1990 calculated that 7,000,000 workdays are lost annually in Canada due to migraine.&#160; It was also found that 51% of all women suffering from migraine have never consulted a physician for their headaches.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; It is estimated that one-half of all people suffering from migraines in Canada never seek help from a physician but rather self-treat their condition with OTC medications such as aspirin (e.g., Bayer), acetaminophen (e.g., Tylenol) and OTC NSAID&#8217;s such as ibuprofen (e.g., Advil) and naproxen sodium (e.g., Aleve).&#160; The main prescription pharmacological agents used to treat acute migraine includes the triptan class of drugs or 5-HT1 receptor agonists as they are known and these products include sumatriptan (Imitrex), rizatriptan (Maxalt), zolmitriptan (Zomig), almotriptan (Axert), naratriptan (Amerge), eletriptan (Relpax) and frovatriptan (Frova).&#160; There are also the ergot alkaloids such as ergotamine (Cafergot) and dihydroergotamine (Migrinal) used in some cases as are narcotics such as meperidine (e.g., Demerol) and the combination drug of aspirin, butalbital and caffeine (e.g., Fiorinal).&#160; In spite of a number of possible treatment options for treating migraines, many of these treatments are without an authorized indication from Health Canada.&#160; The Company considers the competitive market as the triptans class, which currently sells approximately $125 million annually in Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="0E0F4D05AB184F6D842A933B3A5F5F05" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Fiorinal
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	/Fiorinal
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	C
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fiorinal (acetylsalicylic acid, caffeine and butalbital tablets and capsules) and Fiorinal
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	C (acetylsalicylic acid, caffeine, butalbital and codeine capsules) were acquired from Novartis AG and Novartis Pharma AG in October 2014.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C were originally approved by Health Canada in 1970 for the relief of tension-type headache.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 65 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fiorinal is a fixed dose combination drug that combines the analgesic properties of acetylsalicylic acid, with the anxiolytic and muscle relaxant properties of butalbital, and the central nervous system stimulant properties of caffeine.&#160; Fiorinal C expands on the properties of Fiorinal with the additional analgesic effect of codeine.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C are the only prescription products in Canada indicated for relief of tension type headaches.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C are currently marketed in Canada in hard gelatin capsules containing 330mg acetylsalicylic acid, 40mg caffeine, 50mg butalbital, and in the case of Fiorinal C, the addition or 15mg or 30mg of codeine.&#160; Codeine and butalbital are both habit-forming and potentially abusable.&#160; Consequently, the extended use of Fiorinal or Fiorinal C is not recommended.&#160; Fiorinal and Fiorinal C are associated with exacerbation of headache (medication overuse headaches) in susceptible patients.&#160; Repeated use of Fiorinal and Fiorinal C can lead to &#8220;rebound&#8221; headaches as each dose wears off.&#160; With repeated doses physical and psychological dependence can develop.&#160; In addition to dependence, butalbital-containing products can lead to tolerance, and at higher doses can produce withdrawal symptoms after discontinuation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Tension-Type Headache in Canada
</FONT>
	:&#160; Tension-type headaches are the most common type of headache and are caused by muscle tightening in the back of the neck or scalp.&#160; These headaches are typically triggered by emotional stress, fatigue or depression.&#160; There are two classifications of tension-type headache: (1) episodic tension headaches, which occur randomly and less frequently; and (2) chronic tension headaches, which may occur daily or continually and the intensity of the pain may vary during a 24-hour cycle.&#160; Tension headaches differ from migraine headaches due to the lack of aura, photophobia, phonophobia and/or nausea.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Tension-type headaches may be treated with OTC NSAIDs like Tylenol, Advil, Aleve, or Aspirin.&#160; Prescription NSAIDs may also be used, such as Naprosyn, Anaprox, Toradol, as well as prescription analgesic/opiate combinations like Percocet, Tylenol
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	with codeine and Fiorinal/Fiorinal C.&#160; In spite of a number of possible treatment options for treating tension-type headaches, all of these treatments, with the exception of Fiorinal and Fiorinal C, are without an authorized indication from Health Canada.&#160; The Company considers the competitive market as the prescription NSAID and prescription analgesic/opiate combination class, which has an estimated tension-type headache value of approximately $30 million annually in Canada.&#160; The OTC market for tension-type headache is estimated to be exponentially larger given the large patient population; however, the true value is extremely difficult to determine considering the broad range of indications for OTC NSAIDs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="1FC338F2AFBE47C7BAA173715BFB1DAA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Soriatane (acitretin) is chemically known as acitretin, and is indicated for the treatment of severe psoriasis (including erythrodermic and pustular types) and other disorders of keratinization.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is a retinoid, an aromatic analog of vitamin A.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	was approved in Canada in 1994 and is the first and only oral retinoid indicated for psoriasis.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is often used when milder forms of psoriasis treatments like topical steroids, emollients and topical tar-based therapies have failed.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	should be reserved for patients unresponsive to, or intolerant of, standard treatment.&#160; In addition, Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	should only be prescribed by physicians knowledgeable in the use of systemic retinoids.&#160; Soriatane
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	is teratogenic (can cause birth defects) and should not be used by women who are pregnant or who are planning to become pregnant during, or within three years after stopping, treatment of Soriatane.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	&#160; In addition, acitretin may cause nausea, headache, itching, dry, red or flaky skin, dry or red eyes, dry or chapped lips, swollen lips, dry mouth, thirst, cystitis acne or hair loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 66 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Psoriasis Treatment Options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	:&#160; There are a number of different treatment options for psoriasis.&#160; Typically, topical agents are used for mild disease, phototherapy for moderate disease and oral systemic agents and biologicals for more severe disease.&#160; The three main traditional systemic treatments are (1) methotrexate, (2) cyclosporine and (3) retinoids.&#160; Unlike Soriatane, methotrexate and cyclosporine are immunosuppressant drugs.&#160; Methotrexate may cause a decrease in the number of blood cells made by bone marrow, may cause liver damage, lung damage, damage to the lining of the mouth, stomach or intestines and may increase the risk of developing lymphoma (cancer that begins in the cells of the immune system), among other serious side effects
</FONT>
	.&#160; Methotrexate may also cause serious or life-threatening skin reactions.&#160; Cyclosporines may cause side effects that could be very serious, such as high blood pressure and kidney and liver problems.&#160; It may also reduce the body&#8217;s ability to fight infections.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Severe psoriasis is a condition that involves more than 10% of the body area or is physically, occupationally or psychologically disabling.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	will typically be used in combination with other drugs such as topical steroids, emollients or tar-based therapies.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is most effective for treating psoriasis when it is used with phototherapy.&#160; Soriatane
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	may be used with biologic agents, such as etanercept (Enbrel), adalimumab (Humira) or infliximab (Remicade), and may also be prescribed in rotation with cyclosporine or methotrexate.&#160; Biologic therapies such as Enbrel, Humira and Remicade are effective in treating severe forms of the disease, but tend to be very expensive and sometimes not reimbursed by government or other private drug plans.&#160; Cyclosporine and methotrexate are also oral agents that are often used for severe forms of psoriasis.&#160; The market for moderate to severe psoriasis in Canada, including the biologics, is estimated to be greater than $200 million for 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="7B03B1D482B64E27B2CC541B000FC22F" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	Bezalip
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	SR
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Bezalip SR (bezafibrate) is an established pan-peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor activator.&#160; Bezalip SR, used to treat hyperlipidemia (high cholesterol), has over 25 years of therapeutic use globally.&#160; Bezalip SR helps lower LDL-C and triglycerides while raising HDL-C levels.&#160; It also improves insulin sensitivity and reduces blood glucose levels, which in combination with the cholesterol effects may significantly lower the incidence of cardiovascular events and development of diabetes in patients with features of metabolic syndrome.&#160; Bezalip SR is contraindicated in patients with hepatic and renal impairment, pre-existing gallbladder disease, hypersensitivity to bezafibrate, or pregnancy or lactation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Bezalip SR is currently approved in more than 40 countries worldwide, not including the United States.&#160; Bezalip SR is under license from Actavis, and we have the exclusive rights to market Bezalip SR in Canada.&#160; We also have the exclusive development and licensing rights to Bezalip SR in the United States and filed an IND that received clearance from the FDA in the United States.&#160; Clinical studies would be required prior to commercialization in the United States.&#160; The initial target indication that would be considered for pursuit in the United States is for severe hypertriglyceridemia.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Hyperlipidemia Treatment Options
</FONT>
	:&#160; Hyperlipidemia is a very common chronic condition and is characterized by an excess of fatty substances called lipids, mainly cholesterol and triglycerides, in the blood.&#160; It is also called hyperlipoproteinemia because these fatty substances travel in the blood attached to proteins.&#160; This is the only way that these fatty substances can remain dissolved while in circulation.&#160; Hyperlipidemia, in general, can be divided into two subcategories:&#160; (1) hypercholesterolemia, in which there is a high level of cholesterol; and (2) hypertriglyceridemia, in which there is a high level of triglycerides, the most common form of fat.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 67 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC" HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Competitive Analysis
</FONT>
	:&#160; Cholesterol-lowering drugs in Canada include statins, niacin, bile-acid resins, fibric acid derivatives (fibrates), and cholesterol absorption inhibitors.&#160; All classes of cholesterol-lowering medicines are most effective when combined with increased exercise and a low-fat, high-fiber diet.&#160; The statin class includes some of the largest-selling prescription products in the world (e.g., atorvastatin (Lipitor), simvastatin (Zocor) and rosuvastatin (Crestor)).&#160; Statins dominate single-agent prescribing for the treatment of lipid disorders.&#160; The niacin (nicotinic acid &#8211; vitamin B3) class includes brands such as Niaspan, which work primarily on increasing HDL cholesterol.&#160; The fibrates class of cholesterol-lowering treatments is composed of three competing molecules:&#160; (1) gemfibrozil (Lopid), (2) bezafibrate (Bezalip SR), and (3) fenofibrate (Lipidil in Canada or Tricor in the United States).&#160; Clinical studies have demonstrated that bezafibrate, the active ingredient in Bezalip SR, was shown to be effective in lowering high levels of triglycerides, raising HDL cholesterol and lowering LDL cholesterol.&#160; As of the end of 2015, the annual fibrate market in Canada is estimated to be approximately $35 million.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Other Commercialized Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In addition to the products discussed above, we also market NeoVisc
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(sodium hylauronic solution - 1%), Uracyst
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(sodium chondroitin sulfate - 2%), Durela
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(tramadol hydrochloride), Proferrin
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(heme iron polypeptide), Resultz
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	(isopropyl myristate), Collatamp G (collagen-gentamycin) and a portfolio of eight products targeted in the gastroenterology and women&#8217;s health markets in Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Primary Development Products
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="78D6D6987EFD4F6D8A248FC65682F96C" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 1%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="LEFT" BORDER="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 13PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; WHITE-SPACE: NOWRAP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID">
<DIV>
	YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#8482;
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The products in the YOSPRALA (aspirin/omeprazole delayed release tablets) portfolio, which are part of our PA platform, are being developed with the goal of significantly reducing GI ulcers and other GI complications compared to taking enteric-coated, buffered or plain aspirin alone in patients at risk of developing GI ulcers.&#160; The first candidates in the YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	product portfolio are YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	81/40 (PA8140), which contains 81mg of enteric-coated aspirin and 40mg immediate-release omeprazole, and YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	325/40 (PA32540), which contains 325mg of enteric-coated aspirin and 40mg immediate-release omeprazole.&#160; Both products are a coordinated-delivery tablet combining immediate-release omeprazole, a PPI, layered around a pH-sensitive enteric coating of an aspirin core.&#160; This novel, patented product is intended for oral administration once a day.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Pending FDA review and approval, YOSPRALA 81/40 and 325/40 would be indicated for patients who require aspirin (1) to reduce the combined risk of death and nonfatal stroke in patients who have had ischemic stroke or transient ischemia of the brain due to fibrin platelet emboli, (2) to reduce the combined risk of death and nonfatal MI in patients with a previous MI or unstable angina pectoris, (3) to reduce the combined risk of MI and sudden death in patients with chronic stable angina pectoris, (4) for a pre-existing condition after having undergone revascularization procedures, and (5) the omeprazole component, to decrease the risk of developing gastric ulcers in patients at risk for developing aspirin-associated gastric ulcers.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Development History and Status
</FONT>
	:&#160; YOSPRALA 81/40 and 325/40 products have completed Phase3 clinical development testing in the United States, and we resubmitted the NDA for these products with the FDA on March 14, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We met with the FDA to discuss the overall development program requirements for YOSPRALA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	81/40 and 325/40 for the secondary prevention of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease in patients at risk for gastric ulcers.&#160; An IND was filed in the fourth quarter of 2007.&#160; We completed a study which demonstrated that the salicylic acid component of YOSPRALA
